heading: rants & raves
subheading: date: wed 11/03/1999 10:41 am from: sam (samlewis@pacbell.net) to: newsfeedback@wired.com subject: attack on mp3 that article about mp3 piracy is disturbing, (“attack on mp3 piracy escalates,” 30.oct.1999). bpi and record companies want to flat-out hang any kid out there that has even thought about downloading an mp3. are they god? they seem so caddy about […]
author: wired blogs
text: date: wed 11/03/1999 10:41 am from: sam (samlewis@pacbell.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: attack on mp3that article about mp3 piracy is disturbing, ("attack on mp3 piracy escalates," 30.oct.1999). bpi and record companies want to flat-out hang any kid out there that has even thought about downloading an mp3. are they god? they seem so caddy about ruining some poor fool's life over a song. let's round up all those lawyers and executives and choke them to death with their own money. don
